discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C. Strategic conformance

Explanation: Capability Blueprint (pyramid)
 - Tier 4: Strategic conformance, Achieve best in-class.
 - Tier 3: Opreational integration, Improve efficiency and effectiveness through integration with other areas, such as request, procurement, and IT Service Management.
 - Tier 2: Practical management, Improve management controls and drive immediate benefits.
 - Tier 1: Trustworthy data, Know what you have so you can manage your assets.

Source: Hardware Asset Management (HAM) Fundamentals On Demand (Vancouver) -> Introduction to Hardware Asset Management: Module Introduction (V) -> Hardware Asset Management Requiremetns And Recommended Practices (V) -> Capability Blueprint

questions.question_text: Which tier of the capability blueprint focuses on achieving best-in-class?

a c d are correct
E. Software distributions could potentially be considered an asset if they are proprietary to the company and bring in revenue. However, they're not typically classified as such in a traditional sense.

questions.question_text: What are the five valid phases of the Now Create methodology?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCDF
Answer:
 B. Software entitlement
 C. Hardware
 D. Consumable
 F. Facility

Explanation: Types of assets can be:
 Hardware (c.)
 Consumable (d.)
 Bundle
 License (b.)
 Facility (f.)

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-it-asset-management/page/product/hardware-asset-management/reference/ham-landing-page.html
